TopicDetails.title: Grants for the European Consumer Centres Network (ECC Net)

types.typeOfAction: CONS-SGA-GA Specific Grant Agreement -Grant for Action
CONS-FPA-GA Framework Partnership Agreement Grants for Action

29018.action: ECC-01-2014 - CONS-FPA-GA Framework Partnership Agreement Grants for Action
ECC-01-2014 - CONS-SGA-GA Specific Grant Agreement -Grant for Action

TopicDetails.conditions:
Please read carefully all provisions below before the preparation of your application. 
 
  1. List of countries and applicable rules for funding: Described in section 6 of the Call document.
    Please add the hyperlink of the call document. Please send all the call documents to RTD J.3 for publication and they will send you the hyperlinks to be added.
     
  2. Eligibility and admissibility conditions: Described in sections 5 and 6 of the Call document.
    Please add the hyperlink of the call document.
     
  3. Evaluation

    3.1 Evaluation criteria and procedure, scoring and threshold: Described in sections 8 and 9 of the Call document.
    Please add the hyperlink of the call document.

    3.2 For submission and evaluation process, see Guide for applicants – joint actions

     
  4. Proposal page limits and layout: Please refer to Part B of the standard proposal template.
     
  5. Indicative timetable for evaluation and grant agreement: Described in section 3 of the Call document.
     
  6. Provisions, proposal templates and evaluation forms:

    Joint Action (CONS-JA):
    Standard proposal template
    Model Grant Agreement
     
  7. Additional provisions:
    Please perform a financial viability self-check, using the PP tool of the financial viability self-check.
     
  8. Additional documents:
    Consumer Programme Decision
    Annual work programme
    EU Financial regulation
TopicDetails.supportInfo:
Contact CHAFEA Consumer Programme helpdesk for further assistance related to the Programme, the topics, call and the content of proposals at CHAFEA-CP-CALLS@ec.europa.eu.

Participant Portal FAQ – Submission of proposals.

IT Helpdesk – contact the IT helpdesk for questions such as forgotten passwords, access rights and roles, technical aspects of submission of proposals, etc.

H2020 Online Manual - Please use the manual with caution and only for the Participant Portal tools guidance, i.e. Submission service and Beneficiary register, because it is H2020 specific and does not cover the Consumer Programme rules. Some aspects of the Consumer Programme are different to the provisions of the H2020 programmes.
TopicDetails.sepTemplate: The submission system is planned to be opened on the date stated on the topic header.
